Name: Storage Device Message Registry
Description: This registry defines the messages for storage devices.

ControllerOK.Description: The storage controller status has changed to OK.
ControllerOK.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that the storage controller status has changed to OK.
ControllerOK.Message: The status of the storage controller located in '%1' has changed to OK.
ArgDescriptions: The location of the storage controller.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the storage controller location.

ControllerFailure.Description: A storage controller failure has been detected.
ControllerFailure.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate that a storage controller failure condition has been detected due to a hardware, communication, or firmware failure.
ControllerFailure.Message: A failure condition for the storage controller located in '%1' has been detected.
ArgDescriptions: The location of the storage controller.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the storage controller location.
ControllerFailure.Resolution: Reseat the storage controller in the PCI slot.  Update the controller to the latest firmware version.  If the issue persists, replace the controller.

DriveOK.Description: The status of a physical drive has changed to OK.
DriveOK.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a drive status has changed to OK.
DriveOK.Message: The status of the drive located in '%1' has changed to OK.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the drive location.

DrivePredictiveFailure.Description: A predictive drive failure condition has been detected.
DrivePredictiveFailure.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a drive predictive failure condition has been detected.
DrivePredictiveFailure.Message: A predictive failure condition for the drive located in '%1' has been detected.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the drive location.
DrivePredictiveFailure.Resolution: If this drive is not part of a fault-tolerant volume, first back up all data, then replace the drive and restore all data afterward.  If this drive is part of a fault-tolerant volume, replace this drive as soon as possible as long as the volume status is OK.

DrivePredictiveFailureCleared.Description: A previously detected predictive failure condition on a drive has been cleared.
DrivePredictiveFailureCleared.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a predictive failure condition on a drive has been cleared, but any other failure conditions remain.
DrivePredictiveFailureCleared.Message: A predictive failure condition for the drive located in '%1' has been cleared.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the drive location.

DriveFailure.Description: A drive failure condition has been detected.
DriveFailure.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a drive failure condition detected due to a drive not installed correctly or has failed.
DriveFailure.Message: A failure condition for the drive located in '%1' has been detected.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the drive location.
DriveFailure.Resolution: Ensure all cables are properly and securely connected.  Ensure all drives are fully seated.  Replace the defective cables, drive, or both.

DriveFailureCleared.Description: A previously detected failure condition on a drive has been cleared.
DriveFailureCleared.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a failure condition on a drive has been cleared, but any predictive failure or other conditions remain.
DriveFailureCleared.Message: A failure condition for the drive located in '%1' has been cleared.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the drive location.

DriveInserted.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a drive has been inserted.
DriveInserted.Message: The drive located at '%1' was inserted.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the drive location.
DriveInserted.Resolution: If the drive is not properly displayed, attempt to refresh the cached data.

DriveRemoved.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a drive has been removed.
DriveRemoved.Message: The drive located in '%1' was removed.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the drive location.
DriveRemoved.Resolution: If the drive is still displayed, attempt to refresh the cached data.

VolumeOK.Description: A volume status has changed to OK.
VolumeOK.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a volume status has changed to OK.
VolumeOK.Message: The status of volume '%1' that is attached to the storage controller located in '%2' has changed to OK.
ArgDescriptions: The location of the storage controller.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing an identifier for the volume.  The identifier may contain `Id`, `Name`, `Identifiers`, `LogicalUnitNumber`, or other data used to uniquely identify the volume.
The value of this argument shall be a string containing the storage controller location.

VolumeDegraded.Description: The storage controller has detected a degraded volume condition.
VolumeDegraded.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a volume degraded condition was detected due to one or more drives not installed correctly, missing, or has failed.
VolumeDegraded.Message: The volume '%1' attached to the storage controller located in '%2' is in degraded state.
ArgDescriptions: The location of the storage controller.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing an identifier for the volume.  The identifier may contain `Id`, `Name`, `Identifiers`, `LogicalUnitNumber`, or other data used to uniquely identify the volume.
The value of this argument shall be a string containing the storage controller location.
VolumeDegraded.Resolution: Ensure all cables are properly and securely connected.  Replace failed drives.

VolumeFailure.Description: The storage controller has detected a failed volume condition.
VolumeFailure.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a volume failure condition was detected due to one or more drives not installed correctly, missing, or has failed.
VolumeFailure.Message: The volume '%1' attached to the storage controller located in '%2' has failed.
ArgDescriptions: The location of the storage controller.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing an identifier for the volume.  The identifier may contain `Id`, `Name`, `Identifiers`, `LogicalUnitNumber`, or other data used to uniquely identify the volume.
The value of this argument shall be a string containing the storage controller location.
VolumeFailure.Resolution: Ensure all cables are properly and securely connected.  Ensure all drives are fully seated and operational.

WriteCacheProtected.Description: A storage controller write cache state is in protected mode.
WriteCacheProtected.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate a controller write cache state is in protected mode.
WriteCacheProtected.Message: The write cache state on the storage controller located in '%1' is in protected mode.
ArgDescriptions: The location of the storage controller.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the storage controller location.

WriteCacheTemporarilyDegraded.Description: The write cache state is temporarily degraded.
WriteCacheTemporarilyDegraded.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate write cache state temporarily degraded due to battery charging or data recovery rebuild operation pending.
WriteCacheTemporarilyDegraded.Message: The write cache state on the storage controller located in '%1' is temporarily degraded.
ArgDescriptions: The location of the storage controller.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the storage controller location.
WriteCacheTemporarilyDegraded.Resolution: Check the controller to determine the cause of write cache temporarily degraded state, such as a battery is charging or a data recovery rebuild operation is pending.

WriteCacheDegraded.Description: The write cache state is degraded.
WriteCacheDegraded.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate the write cache state degraded due to a missing battery or hardware failure.
WriteCacheDegraded.Message: The write cache state on the storage controller located in '%1' is degraded.
ArgDescriptions: The location of the storage controller.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the storage controller location.
WriteCacheDegraded.Resolution: Check the controller to determine the cause of write cache degraded state, such as a missing battery or hardware failure.

WriteCacheDataLoss.Description: The write cache is reporting loss of data in posted-writes memory.
WriteCacheDataLoss.LongDescription: This message shall be used to indicate the write cache is reporting loss of data in posted-writes cache memory due to loss of battery power when the server lost power or a hardware error.
WriteCacheDataLoss.Message: The write cache on the storage controller located in '%1' has data loss.
ArgDescriptions: The location of the storage controller.
ArgLongDescriptions: The value of this argument shall be a string containing the storage controller location.
WriteCacheDataLoss.Resolution: Check the controller resource properties to determine cause of the write cache data loss.
